content.raw:
Thanks for pointing this out.

I use an automated script to do merges locally (in order to get around a deficiency in bitbucket that prevents closing branches when merging on the web interface), and I use a separate local copy of the repository for this in order to not have it have anything to do with anything else I'm working on. I'm not sure how the camera changes got in there. I did get a traceback saying that mercurial running on the bitbucket servers had crashed while pushing, but it seems unlikely that could have caused extra changes to appear. The changes don't even make sense by themselves without the rest of the Python3 camera branch, which this clone I use for merges doesn't even have.

Anyway, my apologies, and I've pushed a commit that backs this one out.

Thanks for pointing this out.

I use an automated script to do merges locally (in order to get around a deficiency in bitbucket that prevents closing branches when merging on the web interface), and I use a separate local copy of the repository for this in order to not have it have anything to do with anything else I'm working on. I'm not sure how the camera changes got in there. I did get a traceback saying that mercurial running on the bitbucket servers had crashed while pushing, but it seems unlikely that could have caused extra changes to appear. The changes don't even make sense by themselves without the rest of the Python3 camera branch, which this clone I use for merges doesn't even have.

Anyway, my apologies, and I've pushed a commit that backs this one out.
